description: The ivy-leaved maple (Acer cissifolium) is an amazing plant species because of its bright crimson foliage and unique leaf shape. The glossy leaves are lanceolate and lightly lobed, resembling those of ivy plants. This species blooms in early summer and produces beautiful bell-shaped flowers, which are quickly followed by clusters of lobed, red and yellow fruits. It is a hardy plant, tolerant of both wet summers and dry winters, making it ideal for gardens and landscapes. The fall foliage of the ivy-leaved maple is especially stunning, with its vibrant colors. This species is sure to bring beauty and life to any garden.
